stream_context.summary: Kaze iterates on the "block boss" for Return to Yoshi’s Island: refining AI, animations, damage feedback, arena layout and environmental art while juggling ROM-size limits and streamed music issues.
level: block boss arena (factory/junk-yard stage, roughly course 11)

development_findings.summary: 11 of 15 courses are complete; current ROM is 45.9 MB (≈70 % music). 64 MB hard-limit forces future space savings.
development_findings.quote: Our ROM is 45.9 MB… two-thirds of the ROM is just music.

development_findings.summary: Block boss fight core loop: boss circles oil pool, fires waves, soap drops let Mario mount & damage him; three cycles to win.
development_findings.quote: Basically, he runs around… every now and then a piece of soap drops and you can use the soap to attack him.

development_findings.summary: Boss now flees from Mario when mounted; speed, turn rate and wave speed scale with remaining size/health.
development_findings.quote: We're gonna make it so the block goes faster the more damage he has.

development_findings.summary: Damage feedback: primitive-color flash, faster mouth animation, full-body shake while Mario on top.
development_findings.quote: I need to add that flashing effect right now… when he's taking damage it should be orange, not blue.

development_findings.summary: Environment pivot: oil barrel idea scrapped for a tilted warehouse-in-cave junk-yard surrounded by cages and metal grills.
development_findings.quote: Maybe this should just be differently gated off… a warehouse built into a cave.

development_findings.summary: Soap delivery mechanism still undecided; likely janitor Koopa in side cages lobbing sparkling soap that bounces across arena.
development_findings.quote: We should have a bunch of jail cells… the janitor throws soap bars at you.

development_findings.summary: Grills (platforms) will raise/lower; staying off soap during grill phase will damage Mario.
development_findings.quote: We need to make it so that if you don't get back on the soap under the grills then you take some damage.

development_findings.summary: Performance & memory discipline: reuses existing object variables (e.g., health) to avoid expanding struct; avoids dynamic allocation.
development_findings.quote: That would expand the object struct… I'd lose four bytes for every object.

development_findings.summary: Explained custom combiner math for color LERP and Fast64 quirks; still fighting GEO ASM child-node limitations.
Game must run on real N64/Everdrive; 60 FPS rejected as infeasible for hardware.
development_findings.quote: This hack is gonna run perfectly on Everdrive… 60 FPS? That’s kind of difficult.

context_findings.summary: YouTube ad-block crackdown doubled his revenue; he’s happy about it.
context_findings.quote: This month I made so much more money… honestly, if it means I make more money I support this ad block thing.

context_findings.summary: Lives in Canada, German origin; bought a house, moving Oct 23; next devlog planned Oct 21.
context_findings.quote: We bought a house… I have a day off on Monday so we’re gonna get a lot of shit done.

context_findings.summary: Holds strong opinions on philosophy (anti-Kant), swearing (sees taboo as American), and game design (hates chores, values freedom).
context_findings.quote: Swears being a bad thing is such an American concept.

context_findings.summary: Balances project with full-time job; no release date commitment.
context_findings.quote: I have a full-time job… might be any number of things coming in between this and the release date.

context_findings.summary: If he had Mr Beast money he'd scale up team and "just make games forever".

biobak.summary: Provided eyebrow/animation suggestions, combiner math queries, lighting advice, texture feedback.
biobak.quote: Do you have an idea of communicating the player into them attacking the block yet?

badub.summary: Delivered a new track for Boombox Koopa enemies, praised by Kaze.
badub.quote: We have a new song for the boombox koopas that Badub made. It's really good.

key_stories.title: Boss Behavior Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze needed the block boss to look frightened and flee when Mario stands on soap. By tweaking AI angles, speed curves, and adding shake/flashing, the fight now conveys panic and scales difficulty.
key_stories.challenge: Original boss just sat still; lacked visual and mechanical feedback.
key_stories.process: Calculated Mario angle, set flee vector, tied speed to damage, layered faster mouth animation and color flash.
key_stories.outcome: Boss convincingly darts away and looks scared; remaining tasks are soap delivery and grill phases.
key_stories.key_quote: He should be running away in a circle… now he's so panicky, I like it.

key_stories.title: ROM Size Crisis
key_stories.summary: Realised the game is already 45.9 MB, with streamed music consuming 70 %. Must avoid exceeding 64 MB.
key_stories.challenge: Limited N64 cartridge space vs high-quality streamed tracks.
key_stories.process: Inspected sound table, discussed converting some songs to sequenced or mono and cutting one streamed track.
key_stories.outcome: Plan to free 1–2 MB now and restrict future streamed songs; decision postponed.
key_stories.key_quote: We have an issue of just not having any more space for music soon.

key_stories.title: YouTube Adblock Windfall
key_stories.summary: Kaze noticed revenue nearly doubled after YouTube blocked ad-blockers.
key_stories.process: Checked analytics; discussed watch-time vs revenue increase; accepted policy.
key_stories.outcome: Financial boost aids development; supports crackdown.
key_stories.key_quote: If it means I make more money I support this ad block thing.
